description.narrative: To strengthen the Governments capacity to manage the mineral sector to improve the socioeconomic impacts of large and small-scale mining for Tanzania and Tanzanians and enhance private local and foreign investment.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Environmental and Social Safeguards | Description :The Recipient shall, by no later than six (6) months afterthe Effective Date:(a) carry out an environmental audit of the works undertaken under the Original Project, under terms ofreference and in a manner satisfactory to the Association; and (b)prepare and furnish to the Association a report, in form andsubstance satisfactory to the Association, on the findings of the said environmental audit. | Due Date :31-Mar-2016

Finance Agreement :Institutional arrangements | Description :(a) Without limitation on the provisions of Section I.A of thisSchedule, by no later than December 31st 2015, the Recipient, through MEM, shall enter into a memorandum of understanding, in eachcase in form and substance satisfactory to the Association, with: (i) STAMICO for the implementation of activities related to thecarrying out of demonstration activities under Part A.1 of the Project; and | Due Date :31-Dec-2015

Finance Agreement :Institutional arrangements | Description :(a) Without limitation on the provisions of Section I.A of thisSchedule, by no later than December 31st 2015, the Recipient, through MEM, shall enter into a memorandum of understanding, in eachcase in form and substance satisfactory to the Association, with: (ii) Tanzanian Investment Bank, for the administration of Grantsunder Part A.3 of the Project. | Due Date :31-Dec-2015

Finance Agreement :“Mine Closure Policies and Regulations" and Environmental Protection Plan | Description :(a) by no later thanJune 30, 2016, carry out the review of the Mine Closure Policies and Regulations referred to in Part B.1(a) of the Project in amanner satisfactory to the Association, and (b) by no later than December 31, 2017, or another date as may be agreed to with theAssociation, prepare and furnish to the Association, for its review and comment, a draft of the updated policies | Due Date:31-Dec-2017

Finance Agreement :“Mine Closure Policies and Regulations" and Environmental Protection Plan | Description :By no later than June30, 2016, prepare and furnish to the Association, for its review and comment, a draft of the Environmental Protection Plan referredto in Part B.1(a) of the Project, and afford the Association a reasonable opportunity to exchange views with the Recipient on suchdraft Plan, and thereafter ensure that the said Plan is finalized and adopted, taking into account the comments | Due Date:30-Jun-2016

title.narrative: Increase in total aggregate production value from ASM beneficiary areas.
Number of inspections completed according to the new mines inspection checklist and new environmental protection plan
Time to process mineral rights (exploration licenses).
Percentage of country covered by geophysical airborne surveys at 1:100,000 scale.
Revised mineral law and regulations disseminated

actual.value: End Target fully achieved. Revised Mineral Law and Regulations completed and disseminated.

title.narrative: Improvement in Tanzania's ranking as a mining investment destination as evidenced by independent investor survey (Fraser Institute).

baseline.value: 48/71 for policy ranking & 22/71 for mineral potential

target.value: Increase of 2-3 points/palces or more over baseline in one or both indicators.

actual.value: 59/104 for policy perception & 71/104 for mineral potential

title.narrative: Annual publication of mining sector revenue
Percentage increase of household income levels in selected ASM communities
Percent of citizens in participating communities who consider that their views have been taken into account in the local economic development strategic planning process (perception survey)
Number of graduates in value addition from the Tanzania Gemological Centre
Number of new incorporations of ASM cooperatives, SMEs or associations as a result of new initiatives.
Number of districts with strategic development plans that integrate mining communities.
Number of areas suitable for ASM identified and set aside for permitting.
Annual publication of mining sector revenue with an ASM annex.
Percentage increase in share of royalty from PML holders.
ASM database established and updated quarterly
Reduction in child labor participation in PML areas benefiting from the project
Number of ASM operators benefiting from technical capacity building services provided by the project.
Compliance with Minamata Convention on Mercury Reduction Target
Time taken to transform identified ASM areas into established PML mines.
Regulatory gaps addressed (Value Addition Regulations, Explosives Regulations, EITI Bill)
